meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Voyage of the Intrepid, 15 Feet After a $1.2 million dredging job, straining tugboats managed to move the carrier Intrepid only a few yards from its Manhattan berth. They were to tow the 920-foot ship, now a museum, across the Hudson for an overhaul.
PAGE B1

China and Global Warming China will surpass the United States as the biggest emitter of the main gas linked to global warming in 2009, nearly a decade ahead of previous projections, the International Energy Agency has concluded.
BUSINESS DAY, PAGE C1

Actress's Death Ruled Murder When Adrienne Shelly, an actress, was found dead in Manhattan last week, the police first suspected it was a suicide. But a man who was working in her building has been charged with her murder.
PAGE B1

Tentative Deal for Teachers The Bloomberg administration and the New York City teachers' union reached a surprisingly early tentative deal on a contract. The amicable accord between the sides was a sharp turnaround from the rancor of the last negotiations.
PAGE B1
Marathon Samaritans When Titus Munji of Kenya staggered off the course holding his stomach during the New York City Marathon, two spectators warmed him and helped him find assistance.
SPORTSTUESDAY, PAGE D2

Voyage of the Intrepid, 15 Feet After a $1.2 million dredging job, straining tugboats managed to move the carrier Intrepid only a few yards from its Manhattan berth. They were to tow the 920-foot ship, now a museum, across the Hudson for an overhaul.
PAGE B1

China and Global Warming China will surpass the United States as the biggest emitter of the main gas linked to global warming in 2009, nearly a decade ahead of previous projections, the International Energy Agency has concluded.
